intro: Miconia rondoniensis, commonly known as the Rondoniense miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, white to pinkish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens, though it is not widely used in horticulture.
